Description: Marl pottery jar with small flat base, ovoid body, two pierced short tubular handles on shoulder and flat ledge rim (chipped). Exterior decorated in red paint with one large spiral on opposing sides of the body and vertical wavy line in segments below handles, and horizontal wavy lines above the handles.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D31G in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery. Semeineh written in pencil on one side.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
